Any seeds ready at a job's initial launch can be specified via the CXML
configuration file. The supplied default configuration template in H3 
demonstrates how they can be listed inline, in the configuration file 
itself. That template also includes a commented-out section marked 
'SEEDS ALTERNATE APPROACH' which shows how an external file can be used 
for these initial seeds instead, if desired. (Only one or the other of 
the TextSeedsModule beans should be active at a time.)

After the job is launched, the CXML is not re-consulted, so for a crawl 
already running, another technique must be used.

The 'Action Directory' is the easiest: you just drop a new file with the 
suffix ".seeds" into the directory, and the crawl will detect and 
process that file, moving it to the 'done' directory (so that the 
'action' directory stays empty).

For example, the file could be called "monday.seeds" and use the same 
line-by-line notation (including '+' and '-' directives which can affect 
scope) as when included at initial launch time.

It's best to compose this file elsewhere and then move it to the 
'action' directory as a final atomic step... otherwise while 
editting/appending to it, it may be processes and moved-aside in partial 
form.

It is not necessary to pause the crawl before dropping a new file into 
the 'action' directory.

If you need URLs added in ways other than as 'seeds' ï¿½ for example, 
force-refetched, treated-as-already-included, or 
enqueued-with-hops-and-via, then the other suffixes (".force", 
".include", ".schedule") documented on that web page may also be of 
interest. (I'm going to improve the explanation there a bit.)

- Gordon
